summary:
The Ptolemaic Kingdom was an ancient Greek-ruled state in Egypt. It was established in 305 BC by Ptolemy I, a general of Alexander the Great. This kingdom lasted for around 300 years, with Cleopatra VII as its last ruler.

Ptolemy I made Alexandria the capital, a major Greek cultural hub. The Ptolemies adopted Egyptian traditions to gain local support, including the title 'pharaoh' and building temples. They maintained a powerful bureaucracy, benefiting a Greek elite.

Over time, the kingdom weakened due to internal conflicts and wars, leading to Roman involvement. Cleopatra tried to restore power but ultimately, Egypt fell to Rome, becoming a rich Roman province.
title: Ptolemaic Kingdom
